The har- bour, now called Porto Baratti‚ is small, but secure, being formed by a natural bay running into the land, as Rutilius describes. Remains of the ancient city (of which, no doubt, the castle mentioned in line 407 was a part) are still to be seen, consisting of large polygonal blocks of stone of the Cyclopean type of work such as are found also at Rusellae, Volaterra, and F iesole.
